content: Yes, several teams have stood out in their adoption of a possession-based style in the English Premier League over the past decade. One of the most notable teams is Manchester City, who under the management of Pep Guardiola have played a highly technical, possession-oriented brand of football. Other examples of teams who have embraced this style include Liverpool, who under Jurgen Klopp have developed a high-intensity pressing game that is designed to win the ball back quickly and control the midfield, and Arsenal, who have employed a slick, short-passing game under the guidance of manager Mikel Arteta. The use of a more possession-based approach has also been adopted by some of the smaller teams in the league, with sides such as Brighton and Sheffield United using a patient, possession-focused style of play to compete at the top level.
